result.execSummary:
The defendant Apolonio Jackson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50 + costs = $516, due in $30 incriments per month, beginning 11/24/16 and on the 24th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 10 day jail term, with Huber/ work release privileges.

To submit a DNA Sample

Case called at 2:50 pm [sf]
Defendant Apolonio Jackson in court. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock advises that the State has victim rights compliance.
Court reviews procedural posture of the case regarding counsel.
ADA Shock provides a signed settlement to the court.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; Court finds the plea has been entered understandingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50 + costs = $516, due in $30 incriments per month, beginning 11/24/16 and on the 24th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 10 day jail term, with Huber/ work release privileges.
To submit a DNA Sample

[MK] case called at 9:44am. 
Defendant Apolonio Jackson in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding victim rights compliance, ADA Teuber indicates that this is a victimless-less offense.
Attorney Huebner indicates that there was some delay because Mr. Jackson did not have sufficient funds to pay the First Offender Program fee, however he will now be able to pay that at his appointment which is scheduled for June 30th. 
The Court orders that a condition of Bond will now be that Mr. Jackson is to report to the June 30th appointment with the First Offender Program with the funds available to pay the First Offender Program fee. 
recess 9:48am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 7/14/15 at 9:00am
Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 9:07am. 
Defendant Apolonio Jackson in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner explains that Mr. Jackson was awaiting contact from the First Offender Program, but now realizes that he needs to take the initiative to set it up an appointment to apply for entry into FOP. 
The Court grants Attorney Huebner's request to schedule another Status Conference. 
recess 9:09am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Amended Bond

case called at 2:28pm. [MK]
Defendant Apolonio Jackson in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In response to the Court's inquiries regarding progress with retaining counsel, Mr. Jackson indicates that he has not made any efforts yet.  Mr. Jackson explains that he had misunderstood that the Adjourned Initial Appearance was on March 24th, and it was only today that he realized that it is today. 
The Court further adjourns, admonishing Mr. Jackson to be attentive to seeking counsel soon. 
The Court amends the $500 Signature Bond to require Mr. Jackson to go to the Public Defenders Office in Jefferson immediately after today's hearing, and that if Mr. Jackson learns that he does not qualify for PD representation, then on the same day he is notified of this, he must come to the Clerk of Courts Office to obtain a petition form to request the appointment of counsel by the Court. 
recess


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on March 17th at 2:00pm
Adjourned initial appearance on February 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Conflict Review Worksheet
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 4:31pm. [MK]
Defendant Apolonio Jackson in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Jackson verifies that he heard that Court provide information on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given.
After Mr. Jackson indicates that he desires counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Jackson on traffic forfeiture matters. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with EAM (dob 10/18/1998) or BRE (11/30/01) or with Kimberly Moyer. 
--not to make any threats or commit any acts of violence toward any person
recess 4:34pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/24/15 at 2:00pm.
